author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Roche, bold buyer of "Telavant" pride,
Laid down their gold, no sum was e'er denied.
From Roivant's chest, the prize taketh its ride,
Their cure-pipe strengthened, and their chests imbued.

The gold, it settles, yet it holdeth dear,
In London's morn with Gaza's strife so near.
The gleaming metal folds yet fear is clear,
The world in tumult; war's bitter taste of beer.

The dollar, steadfast, holds its sacred vow,
'Gainst gilded standards, ne’er does it bow low.
Tensions of East in ebb, steadiness shows,
In Monday’s light, it keeps its quiet row.

feedItems.title: Roche to Boost Pipeline With Telavant Buy
feedItems.description: Roche has agreed to buy Telavant Holdings from Roivant Sciences and Pfizer in a deal worth over $7 billion that will bolster its immunology pipeline.

feedItems.title: Gold Settles But Geopolitical Risk Demand Remains
feedItems.description: Gold prices pulled back slightly n early London trading, but upside remains strong due to the conflict in Gaza.

feedItems.title: US Dollar Seen Steady for Now on Light Agenda
feedItems.description: The dollar was relatively steady against major currencies as investors’ fears about Middle East tensions ebb for now, and Monday’s light agenda could keep the U.S. currency hugging tight ranges, UniCredit Research said.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
The oil, it slides, as falcon's flight,
O’er Middle-East's unending plight.
As shields bear scars, so markets brace,
In lands where Aid begins to trace.

The crown of Rome, in valour gleams,
Defies the thunder, captures dreams.
Her gilded bonds, like Odin's might,
‘Gainst tempest's wrath, hold the night.

The wires of Italia come to cross,
Where KKR lays gold before the boss.
While Odin’s eyes, in watchful stare,
Doth mark the sparkle in their snare.

feedItems.title: Oil Slips as Investors Keep Close Eye on Middle East
feedItems.description: Oil prices fell around 1% in Europe, with investors keeping a close eye on the conflict in Israel and Gaza, as humanitarian aid started to filter into the Palestinian territory.

feedItems.title: Italian BTPs Outperform Peers After S&P Affirms Rating, Outlook
feedItems.description: Italian government bonds were outperforming eurozone peers after S&P affirmed Italy’s “BBB” rating with a stable outlook..

feedItems.title: Telecom Italia to Evaluate KKR Bids
feedItems.description: Telecom Italia said its board will meet next month to consider KKR’s binding offer for its fixed-network business and its nonbinding bid for the stake in Sparkle.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Oh Nikkei dost thou fall in disrepair,
Electronics, steel in mournful confines lay,
Kindled by cost of flame's treacherous glare,
And Middle-East's embroiled bloody fray.

Fair Philips, ye bask in fortune's kind grace,
Thy outlook bold upgrades with harvest yearn,
Greater-third quarter’s blessings ye embrace,
Restructure, savings, productivity discern.

In Israel-Hamas grim stage of battle,
Interest stirred, Iron Dome missiles preferred,
Yon U.S. invests in homegrown chattel,
For Pacific’s conflict, vision undeterred.

feedItems.title: Nikkei Falls 0.8%, Dragged by Electronics, Steel Stocks
feedItems.description: Japanese stocks ended lower, dragged by falls in electronics and steel stocks as concerns persist about higher costs of energy and borrowing amid the Middle East conflict.

feedItems.title: Philips Upgrades Outlook After Strong Third Quarter
feedItems.description: Philips said it expected adjusted earnings to rise 10%-11% for the year, after reporting above-forecast third-quarter results, helped by €258 million of cost savings, with its restructuring and productivity plans on track.

feedItems.title: Israel-Hamas War Revives Interest in U.S. Production of Iron Dome Missiles
feedItems.description: U.S. invested in a homegrown system better suited for potential conflict in the Pacific than in the Middle East.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Beneath the shadow of the threat that thunders,
In Ukraine, intrepid minds embark on hunt.
Bargains whisper amidst the war's loud wonders,
Promising boon in the face of daunting front.

South Korea, ally true, binds tight to North's rival,
Yet, under weight of rising rates, economies dwindle.
Biden's reign tightens bonds, for survival,
Whilst swift interest surge their vitality kindle.

Bound in the dance of commerce, west and east,
Cook can't weave magic sans Chinese beats.
With Luxshare, Apple's reliance increased,
In times of tension, it's harmony that greets.

feedItems.title: Intrepid Investors Look for Bargains in Ukraine---Bomb Shelter Required
feedItems.description: The battered country is luring investments with the chance to help in the war against Russia and score assets on the cheap.

feedItems.title: Fed Rate Moves Squeeze a Key U.S. Ally
feedItems.description: South Korea’s alliance with the U.S. has strengthened during the Biden presidency. But the country’s economy has fallen victim to the rapid rise in U.S. interest rates.

feedItems.title: Tim Cook Can't Make iPhones Without This Chinese Company and Its CEO
feedItems.description: Apple is increasingly reliant on China-based Luxshare for manufacturing amid U.S. tensions with Beijing.
